key_themes: Momentum exhaustion and technical reversal signals
Regulatory tightening and earnings revision pressure
Forced liquidation risk from margin requirement changes
Rate-cut expectations vs. macro headwind paradox
risk_factors: Exhaustion gaps and 7+ consecutive up days suggest mean reversion vulnerability
Breadth divergence (116 names in healthy uptrends vs. 150+ historical) indicates deteriorating participation
Regulatory enforcement and earnings guidance cuts represent near-term earnings risk
Forced liquidations ahead of margin requirement implementation could trigger cascade deleveraging
Options market positioning (bearish hedging) vs. bullish narrative suggests conviction is tactical, not structural
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 call wall for resistance (active dealer hedging). Support at $670 (active) provides intermediate floor. QQQ: Resistance at $630 call wall and $625 (both active hedging zones). Intraday range likely contained by these active levels; breakout above $700 (SPY) or $630 (QQQ) would signal bullish conviction, while failure would test $670/$620 support.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: 5-day move targets $680 max pain as gravitational pull; failure to hold $700 call wall could accelerate toward $670 support (active), then $645 dormant put wall. Breakout above $700 would negate this, targeting $730-$750 dormant resistance. QQQ: Watch for breakdown below $625-$630 active resistance zone; failure here suggests swing toward $590 put wall support (dormant). Max pain at $621 suggests 1-5 day consolidation near current levels before directional break. Per source analysis: technical exhaustion and margin/liquidation catalysts favor corrective pullback over next 2-4 weeks.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
